clinical_study.brief_title: External Fixation Versus Splinting of Acute Calcaneus Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: External Fixation Versus Splinting of Acute Calcaneus Fractures Prior to Definitive Surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim:
- Determine if external fixation decreases soft tissue complications compared to splinting.
- Determine if external fixation decreases time to definitive surgical stabilization and improves final fixation compared to splinting.
- Determine if external fixation improves functional outcomes as evaluated by validated functional scoring systems.
Hypothesis:
- External fixation improves definitive fixation and functional outcomes of acute calcaneal fractures with decreased complication rates compared to splinting

secondary_outcome.description: Assess Visual Analogue pain score(VAS). This will be a patient reported measure from 0-10, minimum score of 0 (no pain), maximum score of 10 (most pain).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 2, 6, & 12 weeks, and 6, 12, & 24 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Revised foot function index questionnaire (FFI-R) will assess patient pain, stiffness, activity, difficulties with ambulation, and social issues. The score is tabulated from 34 questions answered 1-5 (1= none of the time, 5= All of the time, scale 34-170). Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 2, 6, & 12 weeks, and 6, 12, & 24 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Foot and Ankle Ability measure activities of daily living (FAAM ADL) is a 21-item activities assessing the patient's functionality related to their activities of daily living. The response to each item is scored from 4 to 0, with 4 being ''no difficulty'' and 0 being ''unable to do." Scale 0-84. Higher scores indicate a more favorable functional level.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 2, 6, & 12 weeks, and 6, 12, & 24 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Foot and Ankle Ability measure activities of daily living (FAAM Sport) is a 8-item questionnaire assess the patient's ability to participate in athletic activities. The response to each item is scored from 4 to 0, with 4 being ''no difficulty'' and 0 being ''unable to do." Scale 0-32. Higher scores indicate a more favorable functional level.

arm_group.description: Adults diagnosed with an acute (<2 days from injury) calcaneal fracture recommended for operative treatment will be placed in external fixator until the patient is deemed clinically appropriate for definitive surgical fixation.

Adults diagnosed with an acute (<2 days from injury) calcaneal fracture recommended for operative treatment will be placed in a short leg splint until the patient is deemed clinically appropriate for definitive surgical fixation.

intervention.description: Patients will be placed in an external fixator followed by open versus closed surgical stabilization of their calcaneus fracture when their soft tissue is appropriate for surgery.
Patients will be placed in a short leg splint followed by open versus closed surgical stabilization of their calcaneus fracture when their soft tissue is appropriate for surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Voluntary consent
- Age 18 to 69
- Clinical and/or advanced imaging confirming an acute calcaneal fracture that has occurred within 2 days of which, eventually definitive surgery is recommended/accepted.
- Unable to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18
- Prior surgery of the affected extremity
- Prisoners
- Pregnant women
- Inflammatory arthritis
- Non-English-speaking patients
